Posted: February 7, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is exceedingly entertaining. This is one of the only games that finds my friends, family, and me huddled around a computer laughing and cursing at each other in glee. I bought an extra controller just to be able to play this game with more people! I look forward to further updates and developments.There is little value to this game in singleplayer. And, it currently supports only LOCAL multiplayer. Co-op is a misnomer, because thats the furthest thing you will be doing with your friends when you jump into this game. This game has tight, responsive combat. Some of the monsters feel worthless, but most just take some getting used to in order to be effective. You can level up the monsters between the stages with experience gained while you were the monsters/ghosts. The sounds and utility of choosing which monsters to level up and what branch in their evolution to pick is great. Playing as the hero is gritty and fun. The more monsters you kill, the higher you can level up and also gain gold. Gold is spent at the shopkeeper to buy new weapons, skills, and upgrades. Make sure to pick the right ones! One charm makes you powerful.....but also turns you into a harmless, weak frog! Once you have reached a high enough level, you can choose to attempt to defeat the boss. Be careful! If you die enough times, it's game over and you can even lose your name and progress, having to start your file over! There are some truly intense moments in this game. When you and a few of your ghost friends have been able to possess monsters and traps to get the friend playing the hero down to the last few hits, it gets crazy, Whomever lands the LAST HIT becomes the hero, despite who harmed them the most! I love that feature! I really can't recommend this game enough, as long as you have friends to play with you! Even for $10 this game is a bargain, much less if you catch it on sale!

Posted: February 10, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game is def a treat to play with bots or with other friends in the room.You have a total of 4 players. One player starts off as The HeroThe other 3 players act as Ghosts that are tasked with killing the Hero player so that they, in turn, can become The Hero Themselves.The first person of the 4 players to reach level 10, go through the portal and kill the Final Boss wins!The gameplay is some of the best MP fun to be had, the only big downsides I found was that it's Local-Only Multiplayer..on PC which may break the purchase for a lot of people understandably. Thankfully you can play with Bots who have 3 different difficulties.The other issue I found was a bit of unbalanced gameplay when there are 4 players. There just isn't enough resources gained with the 4 players to max out your monsters or really get powerful with your Hero character some of the time.Here's a review of the game if you'd like to see more!

Posted: November 28, 2016
Early Access Review
Holy crap, this game is amazing.First of all, the pixel art is awesome, no doubt about that. Love the art style in general, it's a nice homage to the old arcade classics, while at the same time having a unique theme and atmosphere. The music is also great.In terms of gameplay, it's a really fun game. You unlock more and more things as you go, so you always have new things being introduced. But for the real fun, you need to get a bunch of friends over and just play this game. It is amazing. The mechanic that anyone who is "dead" is the monster is awesome, because it is not only fun to try out all the different monsters, traps, etc., but it also means that even after you "die", you always have something to do.I highly recommend this game and I hope you enjoy.

Posted: November 28, 2016
Early Access Review
								This game revolutionizes 1v3 asymetrical gameplay by relying on an old game genre and reimagining it as a multiplayer experience. Basically, this game uses the dungeon crawler formula to pit one human or "hero" against 3 vengeful spirits. These teams are, however, not static. Ghosts can become monsters and control traps to attempt to defeat the human and steal his body for themselves.At it's core, this is  not a dungeon crawler or an asymmetrical team game, but a cut-throat free for all game (often only really seen in boardgames or table-top games) where you must work together with your fellow players whilst plotting how you want to take them down at the same time. Thus, the race to salvation begins.You need to reach lvl 10.You need to defeat the boss.You need to survive the pit.But how can you defeat the hero without working together?But are you able to defeat the boss with just the stats/equipment you have now?But why are there no female hero sprites??? #triggered #ermahgerd #triggered

Posted: November 23, 2016
Early Access Review
								This is a great couch co-ompetitive game! I've been playing it pretty much during the holidays since its release, will be third year in a row now! This is the time of the year when I have people to play with as I visit family... uhm. The game itself has you battling to be the hero to kill the boss, you become the hero by killing the current hero with one of your possessed/summoned monsters or a possessed trap, this as you are a ghost. You level up both hero and monsters and the hero can equip various items bought in the shop. There are plenty of unlocks along the way, like new kinds of monsters and things that will appear on the map. While running around there are lots of things for the ghosts to interact with to hamper the progress of the hero. It's almost like a multiplayer rouge-lite. I like it in any case.To shake things up your group can set house rules, like how early (level) you are allowed to try and kill the boss, if you get multiple tries, etc.

Posted: November 14, 2016
Early Access Review
								I'm not normaly a big fan of frantic hack and slash games mostly because my skills are found lacking in that area,However the concept this game offers was just too good to passs up. I think the best way I could sum up the concept is 'co-op' king of the hill. Basicly the vengfull ghosts players are trying to work together to kill the 'hero' which in turn helps level the hero up.  Of course this team work is really just a set up to try and land the last hit so you get to take the spot as the hero. The longer you play as the hero the better chance you have of being the one to take out the final boss of the level.I find the leveling system pretty nice as there is options for both the hero and the monster aspects for each player. The hero gains gold for wepons and spells while the ghosts wrath points for better monsters to use spend to long with the hero and it might be awhile before you get a shot and playing that roll again meanwhile as a ghost you arn't gaining as much gold and the items in the shop might all have been grabbed leaving you less likely to live much longer. so far I've only tried the solo player but I'm positive with a couple of friends the game gets that much better.

Early Access Review
								A very refreshing game that is great fun to play with people who are not that used to video games.Crawl is pretty beginner friendly with only 2 buttons and the 3 vs 1 gameplay with an elegant method of handicapping better players so the others stand a chance. Every content update has me stocked and even the art design and music are great for a game that I only expected to shine on gameplay.The only criticism I have is that while the 2 button style seems intuitive, people new to video games seem to have more difficulties with understand when what button does what than using 4 buttons. It was obvious to me as a gamer but to uninitiated folks the semantic category of what the buttons do seems to be harder to grasp. Still, it is a very fun game to play on couch coop and I can't wait for new cute monsters and chains to rattle.

Posted: November 26, 2016
Early Access Review
								Incredible game. I fully recommend buying. And if you're off-put by the lack of online multiplayer, don't be. Because playing with the AIs is basically the same experience you'd get from online multiplayer, except no lag, no cheaters, and more consistantly fun to play with enemies.The game is amazing about balance, and it makes it virtually impossible for one person to fall behind and end up not having a good time. Here's how it works:There's always one person who plays as the "Hero", with the other three (or other two or other one) playing as "Ghosts" who summon and inhabit monsters, as well as using traps and throwing objects at the player. Whoever kills the current Hero becomes the Hero, with the dead one becoming a Ghost. When the Hero levels up, each of the Ghosts gains 5 wrath. At the end of each floor, players can spend wrath to level up the monsters that they summon during the level. So if you spent most of the last floor as a Hero, you'll be stronger in that aspect, whereas your monsters will be struggling (it's generally better to have a strong human though, as that's how you actually win the game). So even if you're doing terribly and haven't killed the Hero once, you still have a decent shot since you will have the strongest monsters in the game, and so the best chance of becoming the next Hero. Ghosts also gain gold passively through their interactions with the Hero (although the Hero gets more), so weak Heroes can still afford to upgrade their gear once they get to a shop.Overall this game is just wonderfully balanced, both by the premise as a whole, and the amazing level of detail the developers have gone into to ensure that the scales never tip too far in one direction. You'll also never find a more attentive and responsive development team, just looking at their forums or their community page alone would be enough for me to buy this game, regardless of the amazing fun that it is.

								Extremely polished and brimming with content even in its Beta.The 'Local Co-op Only' turned me off from buying it until I could ensure that I had people to play with but once that was sorted, it became a game I constantly show to new players and invite old players to play in sessions as much as I can.It can be played with up to four players which is the best experience, however three works just fine. Two-player experience can be a bit stale and adding AI isn't optimal as it doesn't allow you to reach across the table and slap the person who just killed you, but it's still there!Note that if you only have one controller, it is still possible to play smoothly with four players. Due to the simplicity of controls, you can have two players on the keyboard and one using the mouse whilst another can manage the controller.Overall I recommend this game to anyone who can manage to get a few people over for a session. It looks beautiful, is constantly updated with more content and the content already in it is polished and functional.

Posted: November 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								To me the most important aspect of the game as a whole is the amazing concept that it embodies. I bought this game expecting a regular rougelike-ish dungeon crawler, I was, however, surprised to find it brought a whole new level to a already existing genre. Crawl assembles rougelike elements together with fast-paced and skillbased combat between the different players competing. Posted: November 27, 2016
Early Access Review
								Whether you're looking for a rogue-like dungeon crawl to play with family/freinds locally or by yourself, this is definitely a game you wouldn't want to skip over. This game has simplistic but very fun gameplay, mixed together with a very, very interesting twist of constantly playing back and forth as a human or monsters/traps as you perish within the duengeon.The gameplay is quick, choatic, and can be quite thrilling! You'll be screaming at your undead friends when they kill you, or they somehow manage to get the kill on the human before you. You'll have a laugh or two when a crate is randomly thrown at the alive player in a completely quite room. You also will curse the slimes your friends constantly spawn over and over, one at a time, in a single room to keep you trapped in there for a short while.There are countless different monsters with very different attack moves, which can change over the course of the game through upgrades. The same can be said about the weapons, items, and abilities for the human player, as there are numerous weapons with random bonuses, stat leveling (through drinking potions), trinkets that effect gameplay, and abilities for them to purchase as well. There are various monster sets to choose from, that come along with a deity that will grant the players bonus effects through out their game.Overall, it's a fantastic game with very few issues. Mainly, the only issue I have is that it can be insanely difficult, if not near impossible, to defeat the boss(es) if they are played by skilled players. Of course, that is only an issue with the people I play with, and not the game itself, but never-the-less, be prepared to have a very, very challenging fight if you play this game with other skilled players.

Posted: January 4
Early Access Review
								Having alot of fun with this one! I love the bit where you have to hit a bomb creature into a wall to unlock the door to one of the bosses, because you fight the boss in the same way and it basically teaches the player without having to tell them which is always appreciated. The challenge mode is fantastic, and all of the monster designs are pretty cool and you can tell and feel that they are upgrades to the starting monster which makes their kits feel familiar. I only had a few gripes with this game. one of the minor ones, is the title screen because the glitchy look you are going for just really hurts the eyes and doesnt fit with the game at all. A bigger gripe i had was that the monsters arent colored to match the player, so if a friend and i were playing the same monster or monsters we both had in our loadouts it got really confusing. Also when you first get the game you should have 4 monsters instead of 3 to start with so if you bought it to play with 3 other friends everyone could have a different character to use. overall i really liked this game and it is very promising and i highly reccomend it to anyone. one of the best early access games ive personally ever played!

Posted: January 3
Early Access Review
								After playing with Crawl for a few hours I was torn between to sides. I personally think the game is amazing with friends, a simple 2 button battle system with in depth items, traps and layouts. What really helps improve this games lastability is the fact that you are able to slowly unlock new monsters, weapons and parts of the game.What has to be my favorite part of this game is that it gets updtated so frequently I often find myself coming back to it just to see whats new.The main offput of this game is that it is MADE for playing with friends. If you dont its just a CRAWL to the end of each stage fighting against, pretty decent AI. In the end this confinement  combined with the fact that it only works with local multiplayer is the main offput. But if you wanna group up with some friends and play with some controllers or on the same computer. I reccomend this game, *definetally if its on sale XD

Early Access Review
								Right from the intro you can tell alot about the game.First time playing i was alil confused about "dietys" n stuff so i hit random.It has 4 player local co-op and once your game begins you start by killing your friends. Really sets the tone for the rest of the game as you play a  uneasy alliance of 3 ppl vs the dude who is the dungeon crawler. Posted: January 8
Early Access Review
								Really great local multiplayer party game. Hack and slash, roguelike, action rpg with magic abilities and all the fixings! The great hook with this game is that you and your friends play AGAINST each other.Gameplay:This game is usually played with four players, and if you're short on players you can use bots instead. One character can be the "hero" at a time, while the others play as disembodied ghosts whose objective is to strike a killing blow on the "hero." Once a ghost accomplishes this, they then become the "hero." Ghost players can possess traps, objects, and summon playable monsters in an effort to kill the hero. With every creature the hero kills, that player receives experience and can level up. Once a player reaches level 10, they can go through a portal and fight the boss, and if successful, win the match.After every playthrough you unlock more traps, monsters, and bosses.Verdict:Great party game to play together with friends on the couch, and a great way to end friendships :)

Even though playing with friends is indeed the best way to enjoy it, the AI can bring some decent and interesting challenge to play or pratice !

Posted: April 13
												Definitively one of the best couch "co-op" games ever made. Killing your friends again and again and then dying and killing them once more to take their place is one of the most intense and desperate experiences you can have in a video game, full stop. The animation is some of the best I've ever seen and unlike most local multiplayer games, it does not exhaust its content quickly. You will be constantly unlocking new tricks and traps to your dungeon as you escape from the depths again and again, or lay trapped there forever. New gods, new monsters and weapons abound. Even I haven't seen the end of it.

Posted: February 28
Early Access Review
								Crawl is one of the best local multiplayer games I've played. Simple and intuitive mechanics make up for the lack of information about each weapon, boss, and monster. Unlockables encourage replayability, but different scenery/trap themes would make the game more colorful and make it feel less like you're on the same floor over and over. The deity concept is brilliant to select 3 monsters from an array of summoners, brawlers, archers, and everywhere in between. The only request I have for further development is more information about the gameplay, the monsters, and their abilities. I'd rather have a little idea about the monster choices before upgrading to one branch or the other.

Posted: September 27, 2014
												I've followed Crawl before it was on early access, and it really is quite amazing to how they delivered what they promised within the game.Pros: Amazing unique gameplay, that feels fresh and interesting wether you are playing single player or with your friends!Great balance (especially the release version), all monsters feel relevant and useable, all the questionable weapons have been given tweaks to make them great. The game no longer punishes you for trying different things out and as a result the game feels a lot more open.Great graphics !!!Easy to play, Crawl probably has some of the best controller support I've ever witnessed in a game. Furthermore you can have multiple people on keyboards, someone can use a mouse. Heck I've even used a drawing tablet.Cons:It is (a lot) more fun to play local co-op than against the AI. It Is a dungeon crawl (hence the title of the game), and that can become repetitive if its not your thing.Playing Crawl with my friends is probably the most fun I've ever had playing a video game ever.

Early Access Review
								[EARLY ACCESS REVIEW: So far this game absolutely lives up to it's trailer. Even against 'bots, the frenetic pacing and the mentality of "I WANT TO BE FLESH AND BLOOD AGAIN!" while you obsessively stalk your living prey from room to room is definitely there.And once you do step back into mortality, the race to survive is on again as the disembodied spirits claw and gnash to take you down and walk the mortal plain once again.The old school arcade feel is perfect, had me smiling from the 'Insert coin' screen to the 'game over screen'. Nice twitchy beat 'em up, with some really great animations.Highly recommend even in this Early Access state.]POST-RELEASE REVIEW.Everything above, and SO MUCH MORE. Powerhoof went and added the narrator to the game, randomized the scenes at the beginning of the game (along with the narrator setting up the premise for that match) which really help build on the already fantastic mood, more music changes, additional ways for your disembodied adversaries to antagonize you, more monsters, more weapons, more everything.GET IT. GET IT. GET IT!Don't let the lack of online play discourage you from experiencing this awesome game. Even against the AI it's a blast, and against buddies in couch play it's fantastic. Crank it up, grab a controller and have at it.

								Not gonna lie, this is genuinely one of, if not the absolute best, party game I've played in a while, maybe ever. It's so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ fun, I can't even put it into words. The flow of gameplay is fantastic, the way the interaction between friends goes from Cooperative -> Competitive Co-op -> Straight Up PvP is perfect. Posted: January 16
Early Access Review
								Probably one of the best local multiplayers in gaming history. Awesome, awesome stuff.PvP with a campaign and a twist. Mix of a roguelite, ARPG where both players attempt to slay the same boss. The twist is - only one player can be the hero. Other controls the monster(s) and traps. As you kill the hero as monsters, you'll turn the human instead. Players can attempt killing the boss at level 10. Trick is, you only gain XP as human.As the player delves deeper in to the dungeons, both players get to upgrade their unique monsters and are forced to make choices on how to level up them as well.The game has surprisingly much complexity, considering the controls have just movement, ATTACK and SPECIAL buttons.Add randomized gear/trinkets/spells, and trikle gorgeous pixel art & animation on top. It even sounds awesome.Highly recommended!

Posted: February 15
Product received for free
Early Access Review
								This is one of the most fun games that I have ever played. Crawl is a fun arcade-style game where the game shifts from co-op to survival and is completely competitive.  They could inhabit furniture and throw it, they could command traps to aim and activate, they could interact with pictures and holes in the walls, and of course, summon and inhabit upgradable monsters on pentagrams. Once a monster, or even a trap or furniture kills the hero, that ghost will take his place leading the exploration. The goal in this game is to reach level 10 and challenge the player-controlled boss.

Posted: January 16
Early Access Review
								Absolutely Amazing co-op game. Great for parties or get-togethers with friends and family. Get some controllers, grab some friends, and enjoy this. Lots of unlockables, in-game evolution trees (which are very well balanced) and a large variety of monsters and traps. It's total chaos and is by far the best with 4 players. I can personally attest to the content they've added since I purchased the game almost a year ago, and I'm excited to see what comes next. Definitely recommend.

Posted: February 19
Early Access Review
								Completely surprised by how incredibly fun this is! If you like local multiplayer games, this is pretty much a must!At first glance, this looked like a funny concept that would be amusing for a game or two. Little did I realize how addicting this game can be!Pros:+Very simple controls (only two buttons)+Tons of unlocks and reasons to grind. There's a very large amount of content to unlock through continued gameplay, and what feels like virtually unlimited, Mugen-esque mod potential.+ AI bots - you can play this alone with AI bots tagging in for other players. No need for friends to enjoy it!+ Excellent balance system - Your hero levels up by killing monsters, and your monsters level up by other players' heroes leveling up... meaning in one player is dominating, everyone else gets stronger monsters to try and beat them back down+ Out-of-game challenges - Practice with monsters between games and see what you've unlocked+ Large variety of spells and equipment - Get awesome powers and cool weapons with both magic abilities and even cursed gear+ Cool boss battle concept - Try to win the game with 1vAll boss fightsCons (with suggestions): - The game has the potential to drag - With random gear in the shop, a hero can get powerful quickly or struggle to survive a few rooms in a row. Bosses can be rough without good gear, so there's no easy way to predict if a single playthrough will last 30 minutes or 90. There could probably be some sort of adjustable gold/XP/item-power/wrath settings that would allow players to customize for faster or slower playthroughs.- Only two buttons - Your ghosts have an Inhabit/Attack button, and a Special Attack/Exit button. Many a fight has been thrown at a critical moment by checking for a special attack only to basically forfeit the fight by leaving a monster/object. Just adding a third button for Inhabit/Exit would solve this- No online play - I really, really hope this is something they look into. I would buy a half dozen copies of this in a heartbeat if they added this feature.- Endgame item shopping is often a buyout - As you get to deeper levels, gold accumulates quickly and being the character alive when you enter the item shop usually turns into a shopping spree as you buyout most of the floor. It can be rough to keep your hero alive in endgame without proper gear. The game has a great mechanic of letting a new player teleport to the item shop after reviving his hero AND clearing the room, but that often doesn't help much if you're the second or third person to get to the shop that floor. And if you're undergeared, you probably won't live to the next floor/shop. I should stress, though... while this is an annoyance, it IS NOT game-breakingly bad by any means. This could be fixed with some sort of minimum item system per-player per-floor.Neutral notes:o The game is 1-4 players, and the mood of it changes a lot based on how many there are. 1v1 is a game of slow whittling and constant annoyance. Monster fights are sniping and kiting and trying to break them down over the course of rooms. 4-player games are basically royal rumbles every-other room, and the hero is swarmed with monsters, dies, is replaced by another player's hero who now still has to deal with the leftovers. Control often changes hands twice in a single room. 3-players is my favorite balance so far. Some sort of optional monster handicap setting could add more variety (option to boost in 1v1 for easier turnover, option to weaken in 4-player to make surviving longer easier)

Posted: March 6
Early Access Review
								If you have a bunch of friends over looking for something to do, this is probably the best solution. Normal I think pixel graphics are cancer, but they work well here. The game plays out almost like a board game in terms of rules and style. However the actual gameplay is fun and action packed. The narrorator that you see in the trailer is ever present and gives you a nice tale of why the four friends tried to kill each other at the begining of a round. It just adds a nice depth to it. I wish that there was more bosses, but it doesn't really take away much from the gameplay. For 15$ this game is a purchase I don't regret. This game is a perfect 10, which I can't say very often about games. Keep up the good work devs!P.S. With the two-button/joystick layout and focus on multiplayer, why hasn't this game been released for the Nintendo Switch? The joycons seem like they were made for this game. I don't even like the switch and this seems like it would be a perfect port for it...

Posted: March 5
Early Access Review
								Crawl hides a great game under its 8Bit graphics and apparently simplistic game mechanics. It is one of the funniest and most addictive games I've ever played with friends, and the fact that it is still in early access is incredible. Maybe it lacks content (like bosses) but if they keep adding content, the final game is going to be one of the greatest and funniest games to play with friends.100% recommended.

X happens" allot. Other: PG-young and GF-applicable approved. Fun learning curve. Absurd and grotesque, but well done.
